459e2540-9615-415e-bfc2-024de79bbbff: A dhampir is immune to energy drain effects.
e5da00e9-57a4-438e-970a-f17d002f78e7: A kitsune can assume the appearance of a specific single human form of the same sex. The kitsune always takes this specific form when she uses this ability. A kitsune in human form cannot use her bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. Changing shape is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.
380e204d-93ac-4ab6-88f3-1c6d4f6325bd: Aasimars have acid resistance 5, cold resistance 5, and electricity resistance 5.
fd36715f-3d18-4e0e-99cf-2eaef912db3a: Aasimars possess the ability to manifest halos. They can create a light centered on their head at will. While using a halo, they gain a +2 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against becoming blinded or dazzled.
5cd54841-1e87-411a-b975-e139f1756151:
Also called a ru-shi, a jiang-shi-born is usually the result of some foul ritual or a magically possessed father rather than direct congress between a human and jiang-shi. Jiang-shis lack any natural desire for physical contact or procreation, and their putrefying internal organs make most unable to conceive.
Ru-Shi have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
7a57a285-62ed-4d67-ae62-af0b871ed74f:
Although many tieflings follow the general model of the tiefling, many more do not. Those of different lineages may evince dramatically different manifestations of their heritage, both in appearance and in ability.
Tieflings of uncertain heritage have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used for bluff) and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. They can use the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resist energy spell{/g} once per day. They do not suffer a penalty to their Charisma if they have levels in sorcerer or eldritch scion of an Abyssal or Infernal bloodline.
2827b6ad-fde5-4be2-b0cd-dafac2a377d4: Although many tieflings follow the general model of the tiefling, many more do not. Those of different lineages may evince dramatically different manifestations of their heritage, both in appearance and in ability. Others have particularly potent heritages tied to specific fiendish races.
0ce447f5-e50e-4aab-836a-e0073055fedc:
An innate sense of jealousy and pure malice drives spitespawn to spread misery and despair. Unable to experience joy themselves, they devote their lives to promoting gloom, all the while hiding the hatefulness that lurks at their core.
Spitespawn have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used for diplomacy) and {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}. They can use the sound burst {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day. They add +1 to the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of any {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against Enchantment spells that they cast.
5d494b58-3e26-4e3f-aae2-73115cf10728:
Angelkin are mortal paragons of exceptional beauty, and they serve as exemplars of good and light regardless of the myriad forms they may take.
Angel-blooded aasimars have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Use_Magic_Device}Use Magic Device checks{/g} and can use the Lesser {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}Restoration{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day.
48190ea9-6f81-4bfc-af92-e4c855588070: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, Tristian can adopt his angelic form. All {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and spells from Fire domain he casts in this form are maximized, as if using Maximize Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, and he gains immunity to fire. Also, in this form he has wings, which grant him immunity to ground based effects and +2 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g}. He can use this ability for up to 20 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
7dbd7859-7dc1-4120-a292-064d913232f1: Ascending succubi can use vampiric {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g} once per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g}.
e6ba3b32-e6e2-47a1-9fed-3c55039094cc: Ascending succubi have cold resistance 5, acid resistance 5, fire resistance 10, and electricity resistance 10. Additionally, they have {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/cold iron or good.
4b5e66a8-4580-48d9-b956-1046adddef4e: Barrow dwarf loses keen senses, defensive training and hatred, but gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and a +1 dodge bonus to their {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against undead and a +2 racial bonus on Lore (religion) {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
b3251c85-3309-49ed-b56c-eda4b710bfab:
Beastbrood regard themselves as deserving of appreciation and opulence. Through deceit and sheer willpower, they often achieve privileged stations in society.
Beastbrood have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used for bluff) {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}. They can use the blindness {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day. They gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 2/{g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g}.
330fc7bf-11cc-4ba2-8a7a-070e6dee003e: Blightborn elf loses elven immunities and elven magic, but gain a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against Necromancy {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g} and spells and spell-like abilities with the curse descriptor and a +1 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} against outsiders with the demon subtype.
a736df93-72c6-477e-b70b-b109fbc29e09: Craven halfling loses halfling luck, fearless and gains a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear, but gains a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Reflex saving throws and if he would become frightened, he becomes shaken instead.
5aa432a2-fbd9-48c4-a0c1-c8bd29619bc9:
Crude and boorish, foulspawn take a particular delight in giving offense and scandalizing polite society. They enjoy violating taboos even more than breaking laws, especially if it means degrading or repulsing an innocent.
Foulspawn have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used for intimidate) {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}. They can use the cacophonous call {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day. They gain a +1 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} against Clerics, Inquisitors, and Paladins.
6bf569ce-a8d2-498a-8e05-fb2c8f462e52:
Dhampirs descended from the Vampire King are rare in the extreme. Incredibly beautiful but strikingly grim shades that straddle the line between humanity and vampirekind, sacred ancestry dhampirs are often single-minded loners intent on a specific goal.
Dhampirs of sacred ancestry heritage have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used for diplomacy) and {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
c9ee3bf5-bb38-4dea-9584-1c476ddf74ed: Dhampirs gain a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against disease and mind-affecting effects.
717cbd25-31cb-45b2-86e5-8cf7098a805b: Dhampirs of uncertain heritage have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used for bluff) and {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
51143984-a15d-427b-8021-4942439afd74:
Dhampirs who can trace their heritage to moroi are known as svetochers, and they inherit much of the unnatural charm and beauty exhibited by their vampiric forebears. Svetochers tend to have an easier time than other dhampirs when associating with mortals, though they must be careful that their relatively wanton social interactions do not breed jealousy, resentment, or disdain. They are more often hunted out of covetousness or spite than outright prejudice, so they typically develop social skills that allow them to soothe wounds caused by accidental slights or careless acts.
Svetochers have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used for diplomacy) and {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
739f8105-4d49-4611-943e-10b226e4691a:
Dreary and pessimistic, grimspawn are so enthralled by death, disease, and dilapidation that they often dedicate themselves to ending lives from behind the scenes as macabre saboteurs.
Grimspawn have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used for bluff) {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}. They can use the frigid {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day. They have acid resistance 5.
df285b1c-0b7e-439f-9647-c92d8f5843ec: Dual Heritage half elf loses adaptability and keen senses, but gain +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} and elven magic.
56a1ac55-ca8a-4f4e-9141-dd8c33e3b895: Dwarves and gnomes gain a +4 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against monsters of the giant subtype.
644006fe-885d-4f77-a3a5-2210ab17bdcd: Dwarves are proficient with battleaxes, heavy picks, and warhammers, and treat any weapon with the word "dwarven" in its name as a {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapon{/g}.
a10601ad-7e5a-4f59-a65b-589df0417483: Dwarves gain a +1 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} against humanoid creatures of the orc and goblinoid subtypes because of their special training against these hated foes.
79f0f41c-9c64-4da0-a2c9-08aa59bb34c4: Dwarves gain a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against poison, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g}.
d62258e5-12d7-42c1-9a33-ac98f1e8401e: Dwarves gain a +4 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to their {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}Combat Maneuver Defense{/g} when resisting a bull rush or trip attempt while standing on the ground.
bcdf0d42-bff9-4652-906e-e14320b733c9: Dwarves have a base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} of 20 feet, but their speed is never modified by armor or encumbrance.
c09488eb-243b-4e04-ba56-f71476808702: Dwarves, elves, gnomes, half-elves, half-orcs, halflings, kitsune and oreads receive a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
5e7ff94e-5487-441e-acec-4e70c39cc3f9: Ekundayo's wolf gains a +4 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and Constition.
9af0dc55-7741-4c30-90dd-339c5f6b735c: Ekundayo's wolf gains a +6 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}.
d0e427d8-5624-4dd7-8e21-7830e84aff1d: Elves are immune to magic sleep effects and gain a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} against Enchantment {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and effects.
12a8f8a2-476a-4aad-b7ff-8bbef801f0f2: Elves are proficient with longbows (including composite longbows), longswords, rapiers, and shortbows (including composite shortbows), and treat any weapon with the word "elven" in its name as a {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapon{/g}.
ea493eba-b99c-4d0b-a8ad-52f74dc2571b: Elves receive a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to overcome {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}. In addition, elves receive a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} made to identify the properties of magic items.
ca3249f5-049c-4bcb-b366-a340584ed482:
Endowed with brawny muscles and thick bones, hungerseed always seem poised to explode into some larger, more powerful form, and have a voracious appetite for sensory pleasures and carnal delights.
Hungerseed have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion checks{/g}. They can use the invisibility {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day. They gain a +2 racial bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}combat maneuver defense{/g}.
9690b90b-70ec-4a58-8cec-12dcae0987cc: Geniekin trace their lineage to beings from the various Elemental Planes. Though their progenitors are typically genies, this ancestry can derive from any number of elemental creatures. Furthermore, even geniekin whose ancestry includes only genies can manifest their elemental heritage in uncommon ways.
b06af7b6-e0cd-4bdd-97f7-41fc9c3f2945: Gnomes add +1 to the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of any {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against Illusion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that they cast.
b92361a9-087f-4b4f-9aed-b29a4470e3c1: Gnomes are Small creatures and thus gain a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to their {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, a +1 size bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, a –1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to their {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}Combat Maneuver Bonus{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}Combat Maneuver Defense{/g}, and a +4 size bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}.
ebfba1a5-4b9a-43b1-882c-bccdf79d5f34: Gnomes gain a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} against Illusion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and effects.
918e844c-5344-491b-a87f-45147c8b3f97: Gnomes gain a +4 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against monsters of the giant subtype.
91e7ad72-7d3c-4558-b99f-40d98a0279e5: Gnomes have a base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} of 20 feet.
f76ba751-fe05-45cc-857a-f69fc1b7dfc7: Gnomes receive a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} against humanoid creatures of the reptilian and goblinoid subtypes because of their special training against these hated foes.
7bf3609d-76b9-4032-b843-bf213abb2c6f: Gnomes receive a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on a {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
dc7f0587-c156-47f0-a59c-1a3c1c549cf2: Goblins gain a +4 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}.
c5fc86ef-7ac4-4e55-8626-c381ac49e0d8: God of magic's favor empowers Kalikke. She gains a permanent inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} +2 to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} and a +2 bonus on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.
4b86e753-0b4f-4190-ad29-b47a5a688b66: God of magic's favor empowers Kanerah. She gains a permanent inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} +2 to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} and a +2 bonus on Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.
a6c55a38-b34c-4774-b8bb-f60ee08d9f1c: God of magic's herald keeps Kalikke's mind safe from harm. She gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.
48f4518f-944c-40ba-b657-4c9073752b69: Greater understanding of Groetus's teaching gives Harrim access to the features of Madness Domain.
1b811e89-f382-4a4c-8585-578674b0fda0: Half-elves receive Skill Focus as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} at 1st level.
a7f3dafd-2a26-4b10-a5f6-fe1ebb0d0c3f: Half-orcs are proficient with greataxes and falchions and treat any weapon with the word "orc" in its name as a {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapon{/g}.
ff100042-7285-4960-8595-b66fb44fc058: Half-orcs gain an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} rank at 1st level and one additional rank whenever they gain a level.
f7468756-7cac-4535-a732-cc9ef3f25170: Half-orcs receive a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion checks{/g} when used to intimidate due to their fearsome nature.
57bb341c-14ce-4f69-924f-a7ee685ae30b: Halflings have a base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} of 20 feet.
6b88263b-d76e-4ae1-8c99-3638a42c77c3: Halflings receive a +1 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.
2f7e190c-f43d-4d47-815b-40da9349993c: Halflings receive a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by halfling luck.
d4270732-4f06-4618-83e4-a802e263ba35: Halflings receive a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility checks{/g}.
3d7f12ba-fa00-42ca-9994-f066799ba4ec: Hasty halfling loses sure-footed and fearless, but his base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} becomes 30 feet and he gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}.
231165a8-ed0b-4294-b296-9f0fc6431c74: Hellfire burns in Kalikke's blood, making her ancestral powers more potent than ever. She gains fire resistance 20. Her racial ability to cast scorching ray is replaced with the ability to cast hellfire ray.
363a8104-b71f-4678-8dea-fdc47ca719bd: Hellfire burns in Kanerah's blood, making her ancestral powers more potent than ever. She gains fire resistance 20. Her racial ability to cast scorching ray is replaced with the ability to cast hellfire ray.
c0c50539-86fe-4c20-bd70-1f9de586c67f: Human-Raised half-orc loses ferocity and orc weapon familiarity, but gains one additional {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} point per level.
17d74a46-46a5-4364-bebc-391b4e2a4d8b: Humans gain an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} rank at 1st level and one additional rank whenever they gain a level.
3d4376b1-048b-4d55-9df9-6e909582cff5:
Idyllkin possess bestial aspects and calm dispositions, and often act as peaceful intermediaries between lawful and chaotic agents of good.
Agathion-blooded aasimars have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g} and can use the Summon Nature's Ally III {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day.
b4026095-b3ab-45ca-a66d-d6fd71bc8b41: Jaethal gains a +2 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}.
b77cc321-28b4-4256-b651-0551b86fbcfa: Jaethal gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) on all Reflex and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.
d24c4118-32c2-402d-8096-0dd99112cf3e: Jaethal now can cast animate dead {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} three times per day with a duration of 1 minute per {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g}.
2d653c52-a663-4d20-bdad-b09f1b976636: Jubilost gains +10 on all {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge: Arcana{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
74709c34-1a36-41f2-8ffd-67e1ee10af3d: Kalikke attunes herself to the Plane of Water. Next time she uses her kinetic {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healer{/g} wild talent, it is empowered, as though using the Empower {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spell{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
21044356-a9e3-4d31-968c-95fe75cf564d: Kanerah attunes herself to the Plane of Fire. Next time she uses a fire blast or a blue flame blast, it deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if she possessed 4 more kineticist levels.
013eb6d2-7ee9-47bc-b0eb-669789a6e56e: Keen kitsune are notoriously clever and cunning, often far more than they seem. Such kitsune gain +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, and –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}. This racial {g|Encyclopedia:Trait}trait{/g} alters the kitsune's {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} modifiers.
9f2e16b0-0e98-4a2c-a235-1e2a4216290b: Kindred-Raised loses keen senses, adaptability and elven immunities, but gains a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}.
51d63dfd-088c-4d4e-849c-9073f38b2422: Kitsune add +1 to the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of any {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against Enchantment {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that they cast. Kitsune with a {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} score of 11 or higher (for Keen kitsune it is {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} instead of Charisma) gain the Light {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} to use 3 times per day ({g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} equals the kitsune's level).
f3142261-977e-429d-a0ea-9a473142ffb9: Kitsune are agile and companionable, but tend to be physically weak. They gain +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, and –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}.
97d083c4-6627-4143-9e39-eea28020bfa6: Kitsune receive a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility checks{/g}.
7e4ca819-0b7e-48d2-a99e-994c0ed95b9d:
Lacking any sense of empathy or pity, faultspawn often abhor all ways of life but their own. They inflict severe emotional and physical pain on others, and never stop picking at the resulting psychological scars.
Faultspawn have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}. They can use the hideous laughter {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day. They gain a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} bonus against Enchantment spells and effects.
dc7c9517-16d6-45fd-b16e-318dfbbd5d4e:
Lawbringers are champions of justice and of doling out punishment to the wicked, and often believe chaos is the cause of all mortal suffering.
Archon-blooded aasimars have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g} and can use the Hold Person {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day.
c83b593a-6b47-4a04-acd4-80d537131546: Linzi gains a +2 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, and can use bardic performance for 8 additional {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day.
6223220b-7872-4953-93a3-cf830b396803: Loremaster elf loses elven magic and keen senses, but gains +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Use_Magic_Device}Use Magic Device{/g} checks.
4c32b2ad-562b-429a-85e4-f55763e3e557:
Masters of fire magic, emberkins feel the dual pull of their peri forebear as well as that of a fallen angel further down their ancestry, and wrestle with their urges to do both good and evil.
Peri-blooded aasimars have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and can use the Burning Arc {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day.
c3116ffc-bea9-475a-b5c1-b0954527f558:
More often the result of curiosity or experimentation than mating, the dhampir offspring of vetalas are born with sharp minds and are inclined to ask questions. Known as ajibachanas, they are forceful and precocious, but their progenitors' distaste for the devout is mirrored in their weakness around holy or unholy sites. Just like their vampire parents, ajibachanas yearn for knowledge and often engage in scholarly pursuits, but their mortality drives them to work harder and learn faster. In a few short decades, they might gain a better understanding of themselves and their accumulated knowledge than their eternally childish parents ever could have.
Ajibachanas have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Use_Magic_Device}Use Magic Device checks{/g}.
88ad39b0-1837-450e-995d-ea04b94c9464:
Most aasimars do not know exactly where their celestial powers came from, and the similar qualities of many such celestially touched beings hint at a relatively indistinct or all-encompassing heavenly force in their lineage.
Aasimars of uncertain heritage have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used for diplomacy) and {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g} and can use the Searing Light {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day.
a9aea1a8-6588-4fad-9059-eee198c492e2: Most aasimars do not know exactly where their celestial powers came from, and the similar qualities of many such celestially touched beings hint at a relatively indistinct or all-encompassing heavenly force in their lineage. Some, however, possess more unique {g|Encyclopedia:Trait}traits{/g} and abilities inherited from their supernal forebears, attributes that hint at the precise type of celestial being that affected their ancestors.
d8faf9b9-f9a9-4e21-990a-ba3a517a46ca:
No woman survives the birth of a babe whose qlippoth ancestry has emerged. At best, qlippoth-spawn rip their mothers apart during labor. At worst, they tear themselves out even earlier.
Motherless have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}. They can use the blur {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day. They gain a secondary Bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
0979ddd7-50d8-4f90-9026-6d8415cccceb: Octavia gains a +2 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and her sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} now inflict additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
2964d99c-c6c0-457b-ab8f-70f57d9af3a7:
Oreads are humans whose ancestry includes the touch of an elemental being of earth somewhere along the line, often that of a shaitan genie. Stoic and contemplative, oreads are a {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g} not easily moved, yet almost unstoppable when spurred to action. They remain a mystery to most of the world thanks to their reclusive nature, but those who seek them out in their secluded mountain hideaways find oreads to be quiet, dependable, and protective of their friends.
Oreads have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} and a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}. They can use the stone fist {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day.
19191ac5-d733-4fc7-92f8-7d7adf676de7: Oreads have a base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} of 20 feet, but their speed is never modified by armor or encumbrance.
b0a80ba7-eed8-4ef2-8a5d-d766d9f25612:
Pitborn delight in destruction, especially while unleashing their havoc on what others consider valuable or precious. Perhaps because of this volatility, others tend to simply defer to pitborn, an act that often grants them the dominance they crave.
Pitborn have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}. They can use the stone call {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day. They gain a +2 racial bonus on all {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} to confirm {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}.
7eb62084-2bb7-41c7-8c91-7ecbc4d26001: Presented here are alternative dhampirs descended from specific breeds of vampires. A player may choose one of the following heritages for her dhampir in place of the traditional dhampir racial features (which are assumed to be born from less pure or mixed heritages).
e42ad390-85ed-44f3-aa3b-aab01b405107: Pyromaniac gnomes lose gnome magic and illusion resistance, but gain fire resistance 5 and +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with fire descriptor.
7184c2dc-d628-4217-bd1d-27378f940b97:
Shackleborn are fascinated by mutilation and torture. Though they prefer to practice their cruel art on others, they accept that sometimes the wheel must turn and greet their own moments of anguish and confinement with an odd serenity.
Shackleborn have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used for intimidate) {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}. They can use the web {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day. They gain a +1 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}.
951ac25c-df21-457b-8b43-3eba7eed51a5:
Stolid and indomitable, ironsoul oreads undertake great works, both physical and conceptual, with unwavering determination. Possessed of patience and a sense of self-refinement through struggle, ironsouls reflect their ancestry in their continuous and determined efforts toward self-improvement. Ironsouls are most at home in areas that reflect that same sense of directed and intentional growth, and they operate best within existing formal structures. Ironsouls wear their elemental heritage on their skin, with most having some amount of metallic sheen. Their skin tone varies, with colors ranging from gold and silver to copper-green and dull, oxide gray.
Ironsoul oreads have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} and a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}. They can use the lead blades {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day.
a0593df2-9290-42bd-a8b0-7ab8ad912c93: Succubi can use vampiric {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g} once per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g}.
af4eef82-ffd4-45da-b888-bc00e3c2c422: Succubi have cold resistance 5, acid resistance 5, fire resistance 10 and electricity resistance 10. Additionally, they have {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/cold iron or good.
847d5962-0843-46df-b436-cd5eb0e6eff2: The character has gained a special connection to the First World. Once per day, if the character dies in the First World, or a location directly linked to it, he or she is immediately resurrected with half of their {g|Encyclopedia:HP}HP{/g} restored.
6bd68f88-6708-4855-9f7d-edde1c8a9899: The following alternate heritages may be selected for kitsune {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g}.
57cbc383-cbba-455a-8555-79ae97315ea9:
The musetouched epitomize freedom and joy, and travel the world to liberate less fortunate individuals.
Azata-blooded aasimars have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility checks{/g} and can use the Glitterdust {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day.
b329944d-43b9-4d0c-a94e-3fe87c7741c7:
The union that results in an ancient-born is too horrific for most to imagine. Even in relative youth a nosferatu is so terrible to behold that any such coupling must be the result of arcane manipulation or insanity. Ancient-born's hatred for humanity is reflected in their appearance; from birth they are misshapen, sallow, and painfully thin. Abuse from their disgusted peers wears deep on ancient-born's skin thanks to their physical weakness. Lacking the gift of immortality to offset the wasting effect of the curse they are born with, their chalky complexion scars easily and bruises like an overripe peach.
Nosferatu-Born have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
13de15fc-fd80-417a-a925-18abf3533923:
Their shimmering avian features make plumekith instantly recognizable. Though they can act rashly, plumekith never shirk their duty after making a commitment.
Garuda-blooded aasimars have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics checks{/g} and can use the Invisibility {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day.
a2c321f3-1a20-441b-be0d-f46ac5a947bc: This blessing allows the character to avoid {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g} from lethal injuries and deadly effects by teleporting her to a safe place instead.
7b4264fb-33f0-428d-b3e4-fc047967cde1: Though a living creature, a dhampir reacts to positive and negative energy as if they were undead — positive energy harms them, while negative energy {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} them.
963ab43a-dcd7-4bc2-b325-d2b70796b0ed: Tieflings have cold resistance 5, electricity resistance 5, and fire resistance 5.
7eed4a11-307a-4929-a5f1-2a180be4d055: Traveler gnome loses hatred and defensive training, but his base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} becomes 30 feet and he gains +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g}.
cdfa9c7d-2deb-41e8-a54a-1f40691082b9: Tribal half-orc loses orc ferocity and keen senses, but gains a +1 luck {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} due to sacred tattoos and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature) checks{/g}.
1929a344-c5eb-43e4-95af-515260d3e204: Tristian can no longer see. It takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g} and loses its {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to AC (if any). All opponents are considered to have total {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} (50% miss chance) against the blinded creature.
1399cbe0-79c5-4742-bfbd-b47a5ba2509a: Unstoppable Dwarf loses keen senses, stability and defensive training, but gains Endurance and a +1 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.
e82faa44-fc70-464c-8ef1-f21b519131fa: Valerie gains a +2 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.
53ad3fbc-e036-479f-b0fa-4f59447bd3d0: Valerie gains a +2 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}.
6b7f744c-f4ce-4062-b264-0de67a240ad0: Various places and living conditions create sub-races differing from their peers. They gain unique racial {g|Encyclopedia:Trait}traits{/g} in exchange for losing some of the usual ones.
236d9a6f-4bd3-46f0-a899-e4c856323616: When a half-orc is brought below 0 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} but not killed, he can fight on for 1 more {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as if disabled. At the end of his next turn, unless brought to above 0 hit points, he immediately falls {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}.
d4a93093-03cd-4f7c-a809-dc87e88e47ee: Whenever an oread casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} with acid descriptor, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} against it is increased by 1.
e3044119-6f12-4be9-9f5e-501d900a81e6:
While often rigid, stubborn, and highly focused on sticking to plans and schedules, hellspawn also have a rare talent for penetrating others' facades. They know a lie when they hear one, and can often determine what hidden vice or secret shame motivates another.
Hellspawn have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, and a +2 racial bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used for diplomacy) and {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}. They can use the scorching ray {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day. They do not suffer a penalty to their Charisma if they have levels in sorcerer or eldritch scion of an Infernal bloodline.
64ebba9b-ae35-4897-95c5-10712435a971:
With scintillating personalities to match their captivating appearances, gemsoul oreads command attention — and prefer it that way. Gemsouls tend to have large egos and are flashy in their relationships. They gravitate toward artistic pursuits, most frequently of a performative nature, though they also have a strong tradition of symmetric poetry. Gemsouls prefer to make their homes in flamboyant societies or places where they can make meaningful personal contributions, as well as in nations that appreciate cultivated beauty. Gemsouls typically have dazzling, faceted skin, along with a cluster of crystalline formations instead of hair and pupil-less eyes of vivid colors. Some favor tattoos in complex, branching geometric shapes, and they can frequently be seen wearing silks or brightly dyed linen to contrast their complexions.
Gemsoul oreads have a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} and a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}. They can use the color spray {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day.
322fc29f-b05d-4f06-a781-f20204d31f07: You are a usual exemplar of your {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g}.
